hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Dear Indigo, please don't change a thing!
happy_review: Everything. Absolutely everything. My expectations were exceeded in every respect. From stunning decor, fantastic room design with a wonderfully tiled bathroom - huge - with sitting area set up with traditional footbath amenities. The toilet and another washbasin is in its own room, so there's no waiting for someone to finish their shower :) Also beautiful furniture and colours, lovely touches with tea and coffee set-up, and the lovely coffee table is actually a Carrom game table - just ask reception for the game pieces if you'd like to play. We enjoyed the lovely pool and bar on the rooftop. Very, very nice with outstanding views. Also, there's a great gym. Now to the wonderful team looking after you - fabulous hospitality and professionalism. Everybody who we met was so lovely and helpful. Dendry helped us enormously, our flights were an issue with ongoing delays, he made sure we were accommodated last minute when we firstly extended our checkout (small additional charge), then we had to make it an extra night and that additional cost was absorbed into the next night's rate. There's real pride here in a truly beautiful hotel. There are lots of great eating options nearby as well. We sought out a nearby hawker market on recommendation, and it was fabulous. I want to come back just to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Hotel with great decor and a lovely swimming pool in a lively neighborhood.
happy_review: The decor of the rooms is lovely. Love the shower with the view over town :-). The swimming pool is great and the breakfast is delicious. The staff at the breakfast remembers you after day 1 and at day 2 they ask if you want the same Earl Grey tea. That's really attentitive. The neighborhood is lively and has a soul, compared to other neighborhoods in Singapore. The hotel is nicely situated, when using taxis. When you want to use the metro, then you better search for another hotel as this hotel is about 25 min walk from the nearest metro station.
unhappy_review: The area between the reception and the breakfast/restaurant is a bit cold and doesn't really seem to have a purpose. You can't really sit in it as it misses atmosphere and is cold.

unhappy_review: very small and crowded restaurant at time of breakfast. however, the staff were doing their best to solve the problem even their number is view.the lobby is very small, not to the basic standard of a five star hotel, even four.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Modern with a old heritage twist
happy_review: The room was amazing! huge size, really comfy, loved the extra touches like the sweets, robe etc. location - I really enjoyed being able to explore Katong. it is a little far from the city centre but if you like exploring away from tourist attractions then i reccomend staying here.It was really clean and modern and it made our stay in singapore that bit better
unhappy_review: our only complaints are;for the cost that we paid, you expect there to be a bit more included like breakfast. also, the pool service was absent - we loved the pool but it was a bit difficult to get a drink as there was no staff there. also, the laundry is far too expensive. we ended up having to go next door to the holiday inn express to do a load wash. the staff were overall friendly, however on arrival, the lady at the desk could have made the checking-in process a lot simpler. she was not very clear about the credit card process, and when asking her simple questions she was providing very long convoluted answers.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: A short trip to watch LFC pre season games
happy_review: Room was spotlessly clean & spacious for 2 brothers. Receptionist was super friendly & helpful. Appreciated the free complimentary snacks. Location is fabulous with short walking distance to many restaurants and the 7 storey shopping mall is conveniently just next door. Just a short drive from the airport and about 10 mins to the National Stadium
unhappy_review: Trivial really. Room does not have men grooming kits ie disposable comb & shaver

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: An exceptional way to spend our 27 hour transit time, such a gem and only a 15 minute taxi ride from Changi airport.
happy_review: Fantastically helpful staff who gave us very early access to our room. Decor was unique with many engaging touches such as foot bathing bowl and salts in our room. Beds very comfortable. Great district for shopping and eating and walking distance to the sea.
unhappy_review: It was all good

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: Everything was good

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Welcoming environment. Beutifully maintained property with great rooms and beds.
happy_review: Made very welcome on arrival. No concierge- but reception staff helped with bags. Room was large with a very comfortable bed. Air con was first rate. Pool area was spacious with lots of towels. Lovely views over city. Gym had first rate equipment.
unhappy_review: Not very central. Took cabs everwhere.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: It's not MBS, but with a third of price, you get (almost) the same luxury!
happy_review: The room had panoramic view to the city, from the shower/bathroom (of course, with shades).The rooftop Pool was fantasticThe reception took care of our luggage, after checkout, 6 hours freeThe room had Nespresso, Water Boiler, hair dryer, flat iron (for clothes), slippers...
unhappy_review: The price (225 euro one night) i found a little too expensive, but it was the price expected.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: Very modern and beautifully decorated rooms. Great shower. Infinity pool with a view. Great staff. 5 stars service.
unhappy_review: The location is a bit remote from the city centre - but taxis are not expensive.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Very cool hotel conveniently close to airport
happy_review: Very convenient location - we were looking for a nice hotel relatively close to the airport and this is only 15 mins drive. However, it manages to avoid the depressing airport hotel vibe - rooms were very cool and the rooftop bar area is lovely. Also lots of small bars and eateries on the road outside. Staff were great.
unhappy_review: Nothing

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel

happy_review: Excellent breakfast and pool area

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: The pool, view and a decent night of sleep!
happy_review: Loved the pool, the view and the interior of the hotel. Bathroom with view was also a nice touch ðŸ˜ Mattress comfortable!
unhappy_review: Bit far from the metro so kind of necessary to grab a taxi. Shower was bit difficult: either a bit too hot or too cold (no in-between modeâ€¦)

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: Staff were fabulous and always ready to assist.  We had never stayed in this area before but would certainly return.  Handy to a multitude of restaurants/eating locations.  Close enough to airports and other sites that taxis do not cost a fortune.  It was so much more than just a room - so much space, stylishly decorated and a bar fridge that was always super cold - now that is hard to find! You could forget you were in a hotel room.  The bed was SO comfortable.
unhappy_review: Nothing to dislike regarding hotel itself or staff.  Was a little on the high side for price but it would not deter us from returning.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: excellent staff making a great stay greater
happy_review: all the staff members were super helpful and cheerful. despite the full house they worked hard to cater to all our needs quickly.the rooms were excellent with classy authentic design, plenty of room for chilling (a mini sofa and a corner for dipping our feet in warm water to rest after 10000 steps of walking daily).The bed was comfortable which helped us recharge every day without fail.the location isnâ€™t very near the city center but the neighbourhood is a great spot for strolling around.overall we had a great time in Singapore partly thanks to our comfy stay in Hotel Indigo Katong.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: Fun place to stay. Loved the colorful quirky interiors, the in room coffee machine and sweets, the roof top pool and gym and the breakfast

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: Very clean. Well thought our room design. Beautiful details in room. Nespresso machine and tea/coffee facility tastefully housed in cabinet.  Lovely views out on to the local neighbourhood. Close to local bus into cbd. About 15 minute ride. Right next door to shopping square with food outlets. Plenty restaurant also locally across the road. Lovely helpful and attentive staff. Great breakfast buffet and a to order hot breakfast menu. Close drive to airport so convenient on arrival and departure.
unhappy_review: Slightly out of central cbd more than expected but a charming local neighbourhood. Easy access to bus into the city though.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: A charmingly appointed hotel with great heritage views, a pool, and close to the airport
happy_review: We really liked the deluxe twin with heritage view. The rooms themselves are very well designed and incorporate nice touches such as local sweets and a footbath. The roof top swimming pool feels like a necessity when staying during super hot weather as it has been recently. All the staff we encountered were friendly and efficient.  Breakfast included proper expresso coffee and a reasonable range of local and European items. Katong is a great location, quieter and more easy going than central Singapore and about 15 minutes to the airport during non peak periods.
unhappy_review: Nothing we did not like.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
room_info: 1 King Bed Standard Heritage View with Bath
review_title: Great hotel - will definitely be back
happy_review: Room was large and bed was comfortable plus the room even included snacks and gym equipment (yoga mat and free weights) to keep active. Staff were friendly and went out of the way to help plus breakfast in Baba chews was amazing too.
unhappy_review: Although close to the beach you are very far out of the city (over an hour walk or 20-25 minutes to the nearest tube). Tends to be very busy evenings and weekends in and around the hotel so you are strongly advised to pre-book. Also watch out for the hidden charges (not a hotel but moreover Singapore problem) as GST plus Service charge works out at 17% more and applies to nearly everything you buy and tends to be added on top of the price advertised.

review_title: excellent standard of hotel not the same mould as others in singapore
happy_review: the staff were some of the best and most courteous I have ever encountered. they were unfailingly welcoming, friendly and helpful.the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in! I wish I could take it with me everywhere.the shower with rainfall head and with a view out over the city is so fantastic! spent too long in there!the room is so pretty, cosy and comfortable.the rooftop pool area is very cool.the breakfast, once I got used to the set up, was  overall good with nice juices and superb attentive and friendly staff- really top notch.
unhappy_review: I really love a traditional hotel breakfast buffet and this is sort of not- it's half buffet and half cook to order. the special dishes were a bit hit and miss but some of them were super delicious. the western breakfast options were ok but not great. the pastries were not kept warm so they get kind of tough quickly. but the staff at Baba Chews (where breakfast is) was superb.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
room_info: 1 King Bed Standard Heritage View with Bath
review_title: We had a lovely stay at Hotel Indigo Katong and would recommend the hotel to other travellers
happy_review: The room is very nice and clean, the standout feature is the round bathtub overlooking the city.The location is great - situated in the centre of Katong city within walking distance to restaurants/bars/shops, and 10mins walk to East Coast Park.  Now, if you want to be close to Marina Bay/Merlion/Gardens by the Bay, this is probably not the hotel for you.  We stayed here for 2 nights and at the Ritz Carlton Millenia for 2 nights so we can be closer to the city centre, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Katong and highly recommend that you experience it for yourself.Loved the rooftop pool.Staff are very friendly.P.s. I changed my score from 9 to 10 because after reviewing my other hotel reviews, I don't think it would be fair to not give it a 10!
unhappy_review: The only negative is not having a luggage rack in the room or a dedicated space for luggage.  There is some closet space for suitcases and luggage but it was inconvenient to open and close the closet door.  It's a small thing and probably a non-issue if we hadn't been so lazy.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: One of the top hotels in Singapore (if not the best)
happy_review: Having travelled some of the bests hotels in the world, by comparison, Indigo Katong is an outstanding hotel. I will just mention the highlights.The breakfast quality and choices available are outstanding. The service is impeccable, in particular Merry, Kelly and Megan but also the rest of the team who all made us feel home and welcome. Easily 10/10 for the breakfast and service.The same for the reception staff who are very friendly, attentive and caring. Never walked past the reception desk without a warm smile and hello. Again easily 10/10.The room was great and perfectly clean, and we loved the Singaporean traditional style. Overall, we had an amazing stay and are planning to come back in the future.Thanks to everyone at Indigo Katong for making our stay so special and memorable.Side note - Katong is a lovely area and in fact our favourite in Singapore.
unhappy_review: No dislikes in this amazing hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: Very quirky but comfortable hotel in a great location. We were upgraded to a room with better views as we went during our honeymoon which was great. Service by Wilson was 10/10 - super friendly and very helpful with suggestions and recomendations.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: Staff very nice
unhappy_review: No MRT

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Perfect stay and absolutely love it
happy_review: The room design is so unique and pretty,  very clean, detailed decor with peranakan style, the small little details they arrange the room is so perfect. totally love this room. Location is very convenient as well, directly next door is a shopping mall I12 mall and a short walk is Parkway Parade. The surroundings is chill with lots of cafe to chill out in the afternoon and lots of good food at night within walking distance. Also nearby approx 8-10mins walk is East Coast Park whereby lots of activities like cycling, wind surfing, or simply people jogging and walking their dog, very lovely way to spend the afternoon. This hotel location is great, direct bus to Orchard or from airport. highly recommend this hotel
unhappy_review: Nothing, this is perfect

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Wonderful staycation for the family of 3 generations!
happy_review: Super fast checking in&out, attentive staff who look into guestâ€™s requests, eye catching design combine heritage and modern elements, the infinite pool, itâ€™s location
unhappy_review: Nil

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Delightful and too brief - only one night when we had a five hour delay en route...
happy_review: This quirky boutique hotel is exactly what we like.  The staff were without exception helpful and charming.  We liked the location in Katong - having stayed at the huge soulless Marina Bay a few years ago.we checked in at 3.00 am having been delayed five hours on our flight and were welcomed with huge smiles.
unhappy_review: We liked everything!  Staff were all delightful and charming

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
room_info: 1 King Bed Standard Heritage View with Bath
happy_review: Very friendly staff and nice hotel. Liked the room and the views.
unhappy_review: Wished there was something to be used for the bathtub such as bubbles or bath bomb.

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: A great option for a Singapore stopover
happy_review: Beautiful quiet hotel, staff were excellent
unhappy_review: Our room 1506 right under the gym, got woken by weights dropping on the ground!

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
happy_review: beautiful spot. very polite and helpful staff. Nice pool and gym on the roof. if you like the smell of ginger, this is the place
unhappy_review: breakfast was not included in a very high rate

hotel_name: Hotel Indigo Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
review_title: Very enjoyable and will stay again
happy_review: Great check in process with very helpful staff. Late check was not a problem for my late flight. Plenty to see around the area and not far from airport.
unhappy_review: Nothing

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: its just in the city. infront of mall.very near in mrt stationâ€¦ most of all the service, thank you for making my daughterâ€™s presents the bestâ€¦they upgrade our room and put some items to make my daughter happyâ€¦ thank you so much paradox and the managementâ€¦ really appreciate!!!

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Beds were comfortable. Location is excellent, and nearby MRT so you can easily travel around the city.Our room had a good size. Other types of rooms looked small though.
unhappy_review: Breakfast was of poor quality compared to other 4 and 5 star hotels, and very busy (often a queue outside)Pool was very cold and areas around the pool not very clean.We were on the side, so view wasn't stunning. However it was quiet on the side, except for one night with loud music outside.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location!
unhappy_review: Slow check in Process and very busy during breakfast.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Love the hotel,love the location,very friendly & helpful staff...
happy_review: Didn't have any Breakfasts,too too expensive,not value for money,
unhappy_review: Liked everything, I think we  pay enough for room,that bfast could be included,or a cheaper alternative for a light meal.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Large room, comfy beds, good selection of tv channels. Generous with the tea/coffee. Great location for nightlife, restaurants.
unhappy_review: For such an expensive hotel... the hotel rooms are dated. Hotel looks like it was built in the 1980s. Grand resort-style, unusual for a city hotel. Bathroom lighting is good, but the room itself a bit dim. Windows and frames are old and in need of replacement. Didn't provide much insulation from late night restaurant noise. No walk-in shower. Only a kettle, no Nespresso machine. One of the 2 floor lamps had a very dim bulb. One of the 2 reading lights was broken. I reported this to reception, but no one came to fix it. Double beds instead of  the usual queen size. Our room had an ants problem.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The location was close to the river, restaurants, MRT and China town. The hotel was very clean and the pool was a great size with plenty of outdoor space for lying in the sun.We were in a lux room on the side of level 10 so we  had a lovely view of both the river and fort canning one one side and back towards Marina Bay (incl Sands Marina Bay) on the other
unhappy_review: There were 4 lifts but only one seemed to be used so it stopped a few times on the way. The buffet breakfast was quite expensive ( but normal for Singapore hotels of this quality) plenty of breakfest options outside the hotel though.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The attitude and service from the staff are good.Location is convenient too.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Everything
unhappy_review: Nothing

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great location, very helpful and polite staff, facilities meet expectations...
happy_review: Great location, very helpful and polite staff, facilities meet expectations...
unhappy_review: The high price charged for meals, such as breakfast and lunch, above the prices charged by hotels of the same level, we can also mention the price charged for the extra bed to accommodate my 4-year-old son, which is very high.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great location, very helpful and polite staff, facilities meet expectations...
happy_review: The staff are very friendly and helpful, the facilities are good, the breakfast is excellent, the pool and gym are also good.
unhappy_review: The prices charged for meals, such as breakfast and lunch, are very high, even when compared to other hotels of the same level, as well as the cost paid for the extra bed in the room to accommodate a child was also very high.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location was fine, we did not have breakfast included
unhappy_review: Balcony size was tiny and it was a trip hazard. Some balaconys were round with railings and some were concrete. Ours was concrete and was tiny with trip hazard step back into room. Also we asked for high floor and weâ€™re given floor 3 and told the hotel was full.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Clean, spacious and had all facilities.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great location but disappointing room decor
happy_review: Very good location
unhappy_review: Room decor was a bit run down considering this is a 5 star property

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: did not have breakfast

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: It was a beautiful stay, there will some small issues but there is nothing that the hotel staff can sort out. It
happy_review: The hotel is in an excellent location. It is close to the MRT, close walking distance to Chinatown & about 25mins leisurely walk along the river to Marina Bay. Mall is across the road to the mall. If you like the night life itâ€™s close to many restaurants, very lively. We stayed in the double premium room, was very spacious.  Loved there was a separate tap-filtered water. We were always provided with plenty bottled water & toiletries even toothbrushes. I loved the pillow selection to choose. The softer touches of slippers & even a shopping bag. I will definitely stay at Paradox again.
unhappy_review: It would be nice if there was a smart TV in the room to be able to log into Netflix etc.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The quality of the food on offer appeared good and there was plenty of choice.
unhappy_review: Breakfast was a disappointment because the hotel was full and therefore the breakfast room was packed and noisy, when I left the breakfast room there was a long queue to enter.I did not see many heart smart options. I didnâ€™t see any extra virgin oil or canola oil to replace butter. Amongst the cereals I did not see any muesli type option or natural low fat yougurt or skimmed milk.Also 36$ maybe ok to pay if you are going to eat enough to feed several people but if you need something small or light then it is way to much, consequently for four of my five mornings I went elsewhere. I was not offered an Ã  la carte option.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Superb from check in to check out. Would certainly return again.
happy_review: Didnâ€™t have breakfast
unhappy_review: Liked the whole experience. Would have liked water in the fridge.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great hotel experience with great customer service
happy_review: Great professional service , very clean . Breakfast was excellent. Staff so helpful when we needed to extend one room due to sickness . Highly recommend hotel
unhappy_review: Nothing all good

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Stayed for new years, wasn't disappointed, I would come back again, but stay in a balcony suite.
happy_review: I booked a Clarke Quay Select room. The room and view was exceptional, but because of the layout of the hotel, it was a far walk from the elevators, kinda tough after a long day. It would be nice if they put card key access to the emergency stairway right next to the room.
unhappy_review: The breakfast, because I stayed in a select room, complimentary breakfast in the exec lounge came with it. ... Yes you had a nice view being on an upper floor, but the serving area is a Galley arrangement, very tight and only a couple of people could access the offerings at a time. I ate in the 1st floor restaurant the last day I was there, they had more options, less congestion, station chefs for omelets, the food seemed fresher, more staff for assistance, and the surroundings/furnishings were at least as good, maybe better then the exec lounge.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Nothing special, no help with luggage to room
happy_review: Central location
unhappy_review: Over priced

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Breakfast was good, room comfortable, location excellent (so close to the SMRT). Great to be able to wander 50 metres from the hotel, buy an ice cream and sit on the steps enjoying the river on a balmy night.Pool and its surrounds were great.
unhappy_review: After a month of hotels in 4 Asian countries, I'd got used to friendly interactions with staff, so I was a bit disappointed by the impersonal nature of the stay here. I guess it's to be expected in a large hotel in a large city. The staff certainly were not rude or discourteous though.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: A very good well fun hotel with out doubt one of the best locations in Singapore
happy_review: Very central and easy to get to every where quickly
unhappy_review: There really was nothing I didnâ€™t like about the hotelPossibly the bar shutting at 23 00hs really was in acceptable I had invited friends back for a drink aftet we had all been out for the evening and I was told at 23  10 hrs I could not be served !!! an embarrassment for myself and the hotel .

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Hotel was great! Rooms were big and comfortable and all the staff were super helpful!!
unhappy_review: The communal areas of the hotel were very cold

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Central location, breakfast, helpful staff
unhappy_review: Bit pricey. Noisy at night with the live music venue next door. Jeepers!

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: We only stayed two nights but were made very welcome. Excellent staff.
unhappy_review: Nothing to dislike. Great value

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

happy_review: Location, pool area great, great lobby bar

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Room-breakfast-pool.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location was good
unhappy_review: Beds were too hard and pillows awful which meant sleeping was tough

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Great location for sightseeing.  Staff was helpful and business-like.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Loved location right next to Clarke Quay
unhappy_review: Beds were very hard

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Enjoyable and just what we expected from a top hotel in Singapore.
happy_review: I liked the room with the extra addition of the drinking water tap in the bathroom. I enjoyed being able to open the small balcony door and sit outside. The standard of cleanliness was outstanding.
unhappy_review: The only disappointment was the buffet breakfast. The coffee was not up to my expectation. The quality of the food was just okay. There were ample choices of dishes, but I have a small appetite and like to eat fruit and cold dishes for breakfast and maybe a pastry or two. Sorry!

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Very nice, recently furbished, clean room, with balcony.
unhappy_review: The breakfast was a low point. It was outrageously expensive and no espresso coffee available. It's 2024. A pot of watery coffee went out twenty years ago.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Perfect hotel for a few days exploring town
happy_review: Fabulous location. MRT station is right across the street. Lots of restaurants along Clarke's Quay and fabulous night atmosphere. The breakfast buffet offers a lot of choices.
unhappy_review: Our room was located on the lower floor and our view consisted of the building next door so it was a bit dark. The corridors of the hotel are a real maze and I dread to think what it would be like in case of an emergency.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Furnishing dated needs granite tops on cabinets nest to beds etc
happy_review: Filled water tap.
unhappy_review: Bed so hard and uncomfortable. Pillows also not supportive. No hooks to hang towels. No Snacks. I donâ€™t like shower in bathtub and opening difficult being next to door as door needs to be open as no fans

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Staff
unhappy_review: Breakfast. Cafeteria-like, noisy, chaotic, limited foods, wilted lettuce etc, definitely a no-go and certainly a poor example to set. It was no inducement to try their restaurants. Very weird bath/shower in second room we were upgraded to (though we appreciated very much the upgrade)

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Without improvements I will no choose this hotel next time
happy_review: Location is fantastic
unhappy_review: There is no choice for coffee at breakfast so no free latte or cappuccino. A hotel can easily solve this by having a machineFurther the pillows are not at high standard causing neck pain Not enough cooked vegetables at breakfasts

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Close to bars/restaurants along the river and china town
unhappy_review: Bit sterile, automated

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The first time i stayed at this hotel with my family for Noel season. Location so good,room ok ,all staff are so niceâ€¦. You can go anywhere at Clake Quay

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Great staff, rooms, and pool. Breakfast selection is also great.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: A positive experience and we would stay here again
happy_review: The facility had all we needed for our short stay and was perfectly located very near to transport to see major sites. The staff were very accommodating especially as we had a late flight so were able to leave bags as prearranged and freshen up before departure
unhappy_review: We unfortunately had a fire alarm in the night. It would have been good to receive a positive response to let us know all ok. Rather than the alarm just stopping and not knowing it was safe.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Good hotel. Very good buffet breakfast. Modern rooms. Downside not Smart TVs so no streaming services could be accessed.
happy_review: Pool was good. Rooms good. Modern. Buffet breakfast great.
unhappy_review: Not a smart TV so streaming services unable to be accessed. A hot chocolate option at breakfast would be an improvement.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Good choice of food

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Not applicable - room only

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The location
unhappy_review: The breakfast spread and the staffs working at the cafe seems to be short of staff they looks impatient and not putting up smile..

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

happy_review: Great location at Clark Quay with an MRT station across the street. The hotel is good value, has everything you need, is very clean and comfortable, and the staff are helpful and friendly. We had access to the Premium Lounge where the staff went out of their way to cater for my wife's gluten-free needs.
unhappy_review: Some of the hotel facilities are starting to show their age

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: great staff

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Loved the location of hotel ,staff so helpful .
happy_review: Breakfast good plenty to choose from
unhappy_review: Food in club lounge could have better choices

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Lovely hotel, with lovely views from the balcony over the river and city. Very near to Metro which was really cheap compared with other cities visited.
unhappy_review: Bit pricey for meals and drinks.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location is excellent. Right on the river and near trains.
unhappy_review: Pricing is on the high side for quite small rooms with no view.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The facilities, like pool, gym and opportunities to have a massage was very nice.
unhappy_review: I have nothing to say about that.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The pool was very good and the changing facilities were clean and really useful considering we checked out. The staff were helpful.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Good stay but club floor room to expensive for what it is
happy_review: Hotel has all the features you would need
unhappy_review: Club foor breakfast not good and very little chooses

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Comfortable quiet room, great hotel. Lovely staff. Thank you for looking after our bags whilst we went to Thailand for a few days. We are looking forward to returning again. Thank you. Highly recommended.
unhappy_review: Nothing

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The location was amazing here, just across the street from the mall with MRT access, also walking distance to plenty of shops, eating houses and the river. The rooms where luxurious and spacious. We were travelling in a group of 9, therefore 4 rooms, the room facing the Quay had the most amazing views. The booking was done a day before (because our previous booking was not up to standard) and we couldnt have asked for better. The hotel assisted us with keeping our bags on the day we checked out, also offered us a shower to use as we where flying out in the early hours of the morning. Really appreciated that!

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Great location, value and property.  Highly recommend.
unhappy_review: The TV - couldnâ€™t access any shows

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great location in the heart of Singapore
happy_review: The location is amazing. Can walk right out onto the banks of Merchant Quay from the breakfast room.
unhappy_review: The hotel layout is a little odd. We had some trouble finding our room, repeatedly (it's a bit of a maze). The availability of food at late and early hours is also not so great.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Fine Hotel but the staff training could be improved.
happy_review: Breakfast was good and the location is fantastic!
unhappy_review: Waiting 45 mins+ for staff to unlock the locker in the Gents changing room after I got locked out.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Comfy beds and clean rooms really make my family felt relax staying in.
unhappy_review: Parking exit with coupon was not smooth. Scanning of coupon not working well and need assistance for refund.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great staff, very helpful , good central location
happy_review: Location, lovely people and staff
unhappy_review: Such a large hotel, long way from elevator to rooms, next time I would ask for a closer room

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Nice 4 star hotel in a great location
happy_review: Location was great
unhappy_review: Breakfast was disappointing quantity or quality

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location near MRT and clarke quay jetty, spacious room with big window, super comfortable bed, ironing facility in room, electric kettle, helpful staff.
unhappy_review: No hair dryer in washroom.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Room was very good size with all expected amenities. Beds are very comfortable, pillows on rhe soft side but a pillow menu is available.Hotel was beautifully decorated for Xmas and the lobby area is huge. Loved the breakfast so much choice
unhappy_review: Wasn't keen on the evening dinner choices, more mains offered preferably

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Great location with easy access to transportation

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Staff were very help full
unhappy_review: The bar by the pool was limited and over priced

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Very attentive and helpful staff, good facilities, great location on the river close to city centre
happy_review: Buffet breakfast with very extensive choice of dishes from different regions.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Great location/ base to travel around Singapore and take in the sights. All catering staff and the facilities for breakfast/ meals were exceptional. Plentiful supply of anything you could want and again the staff were there to make it a great experience. Pool and gym facilities were also extremity good.Thank you!
unhappy_review: The only criticism I have is upon arrival to the hotel. We may have arrived at a bad time after an international flight but there was no assistance given from our taxi to reception and again from reception to our room. It is not a cheap hotel so there was an expectation on our part of a little extra relating to service. First world problem and once it was raised with customer relations we were more than compensated. Thanks once again.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location at river.When I requested another room the staff was very helpfull and had no problems in accomodating My request.
unhappy_review: Service personel in the restaurant not quite understanding another language. E.g.waiter replaced the ordered Wine with another without even asking. Of course the Wine as returned. Chokeret beer instead.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Centrally located, loads of eateries and close to attractions. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I felt that they understood my needs better than me. I arrived much before check-in and requested to use my breakfast coupon from my checkout day since I would checkout a day before. They said why donâ€™t we check you in so you can catch up on sleep. Super super grateful and thank you for the upgrade.On my bday, when I returned to the room, I was surprised to find a bday cake with wishes from the hotel. I relished the cake and polished it off. The cake was amazing. Will surely recommend the hotel to everyone and definitely return.
unhappy_review: Well everything was great and I donâ€™t have any complaints but there is always room for improvement. Since we stayed for 5 nights, we kinda got bored with the breakfast spread as it became repetitive.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Very comfortable hotel, located close to all attractions and transport.
happy_review: Excellent location close to everything. Great views towards MBS etc. Great breakfast.
unhappy_review: Only served black coffee at breakfast. For hotel of this quality, should have a choice of espresso etc.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Really lovely hotel, great location with Clarke Quay behind the hotel, spacious room, fabulous staff
happy_review: Location was excellent right on Clarke Quay to use bars and restaurants at night, also the River Boat Cruise all just behind the hotel.  Staff were really lovely very helpful.  We didn't experience the restaurants only for some toast for breakfast so cant comment on food.  The room was lovely and roomy also had a desk if you wanted to work.  Also good location to use metro.
unhappy_review: Bed wasn't as comfortable as we would like but didn't stop us sleeping.  Also pillows were feather so if you have an allergy dont forget to tell them.,  Staff need to check behind the sliding door on the side of the bath as behind it was black mould.   Other than that it was spotless

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location and staff
unhappy_review: Need a bit more work on facilities

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: I will stay in this hotel again on next visit to Singapore.
happy_review: The breakfast buffet and dining area are excellent .  The city view and partial view of the swimming pool from my room are very good.
unhappy_review: Bathroom:  The grouting between the sink counter and sink should be maintained cleaner.  Some black molds are reflected to the mirror and can be seen when you are watching the mirror.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: Location of the hotel is very convenience and buffet dinner and breakfast is fantastic.Room is big and comfortable. My brother-in-law is very happy with the hotel room. He says that this hotel is the most comfortable and nice hotel he ever stay in Singapore.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Very good hotel for a short term stay
happy_review: Near lot of attractions
unhappy_review: Check out procedure

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great stay and would go back.

I would have expected the receptionists at the pool & gym which is next to the laundry room, to be able to sell the tokens needed. ðŸ¤”

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: The feeling of space.
unhappy_review: Breakfast was luke warm all of it

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Great hotel in the middle of Singapore with all you could want
happy_review: Fantastic location very close to river and Clark Quay MRT which will take you all over Singapore.
unhappy_review: Breakfast was more quantity or quality

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Good hotel in a great location
happy_review: Comfortable rooms, reception and concierge staff very polite and helpful.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay

unhappy_review: Unfortunately we had to change a room as we needed beds to suit 2 adults, 2 teenagers and 1 toddler. hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Nice hotel, would not recommend executive lounge.

unhappy_review: We had the package which included access to executive lounge, this meant we had to have breakfast in the lounge as well.  The breakfast in the executive lounge is pretty poor, small number of choice, limited quantity, which meant popular items ran out quickly.  Overall breakfast is poor experience.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: This hotel, although older is quite a gem, and I would highly recommend it.
happy_review: Our stay at the Paradox Merchant Hotel was excellent and exceeded our expectations.  Doing the pre-registration online made it a breeze when we arrived and we were checked in in less than 5 minutes.  Our beautiful room was well appointed, spotlessly clean, and had an awesome spa like washroom.  The bed was very comfortable and had nice bedding, and an option for spelt pillows to be delivered to the room.  Although we didn't have a view there was so much attention to detail in the layout that it made this smaller sized room meet our needs to a T.  There was a well stocked coffee bar area, and small bar fridge, and we had bottled water each day.   The desk and work area were comfortable and had good lighting.  There night lights on either side of the bed which were very helpful.  There was a wall safe, good sized closet with lots of hangers, ironing board, iron, hair dryer, spa styled huge fluffy bath towels, housecoats and slippers and a wonderful selection of toiletry items.  The smart tv was easy to access and use.  There were switches inside the room that you could light up to have maid service or do not disturb, that we found unique and practical as well as an energy efficient key system.   The hotel felt safe and secure and was quiet.We ate breakfast twice in the Market Restaurant on the lower floor and it was excellent.  It wasn't that expensive, in terms of Singapore prices and the huge buffet offered a variety of breakfast foods and wonderful coffee service.  Both the bar area by the pool and inside the lobby were well laid out and the staff were attentive and very helpful.   One of the biggest pluses was the hotel's close proximity to  Clarke Quay.  The promenade felt very safe and had a huge assortment of restaurants, pubs, and entertainment within a two minute walk.  Easy access to the city bus system was also a plus and we were able to access the Big Bus tour pickup with just a short walk.  Loved this!
unhappy_review: We didn't have any negatives and have no suggestions for improvement.  We would definitely recommend this hotel and we would stay here again should we be in Singapore again.  From the moment we arrived by cab our service was excellent, and the all the staff from the door people, registration, maid service, bar servers and restaurant staff were all helpful, friendly, spoke good English and they were very attentive to our questions and needs.  Next visit I would make sure I brought at least 3 electrical adapters for charging and using curling irons etc.  I'm sure if we asked they would have supplied us with a couple.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
happy_review: We arrived off an early morning flight. As well as leaving our luggage we were able to use the facilities at the pool to freshen up and use the hotel wifi before our room was ready. We were lucky to be able to access our room a few hours earlier than expected and it was a lovely room. For such a large busy hotel, the staff were very helpful. We also used the facilities at the pool in the afternoon after we had checked out, before our late-night flight. The Clark Quay train station is very close so that made getting around very easy.

hotel_name: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court at Clarke Quay
review_title: Fantastic,  an amazing city, a really good hotel in perfect location.
happy_review: Hotel exceeded expectations in all respects. Room huge by local standards on 8th floor and had good balcony and a view out over hotel freeform swimming pool ( open until 10.00 ! ) and river and included a bath and walk in shower. Staff great , very quick check in . Breakfast ,very good choice of food, set you up for day. Location on river at Clarke Quay easy if you like to walk but MLT station opposite hotel if you prefer ( We only used MLT once to Sentosa , cost Â£7 return easy to use , as we preferred to walk ) . Taxi to / from airport Â£15 - Â£20 takes 20 -25 mins. Restaurants in main tourist areas pricy but move into the mall food halls and costs reasonable.Some reviews we read prior to booking left us a little doubt but were totally incorrect from our experience, a class hotel , in a perfect location , in an amazing city !!
unhappy_review: Nothing !! unless you count slight creak on bathroom door hinge !!
